decks.notes: The main concept of this Dimir control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of countering spells, removing threats, and drawing cards efficiently. By using cards like Counterspell, Snuff Out, and Thought Scour, the deck aims to control the game's tempo and prevent the opponent from developing their board. Additionally, the deck includes card draw options like Mental Note and Brainstorm to ensure the player has access to the right cards at the right time. Overall, the deck focuses on outlasting the opponent while slowly grinding out a win.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through a combination of removal spells, creature sacrifice effects, and graveyard hate. It aims to outvalue opponents by generating card advantage with effects like Ichor Wellspring and Lembas, while also using Golgari and Jund lands to provide additional value. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Bojuka Bog helps to disrupt opponents' graveyard strategies. The deck also includes finishers like Accursed Marauder and Crypt Rats to close out games.

This Jund Aggro deck aims to quickly swarm the board with creatures like Refurbished Familiar and use sacrifice effects like Fanatical Offering to create advantage. The deck features mana fixing with cards like Twisted Landscape and utilizes artifact synergies with cards like Ichor Wellspring. Removal spells like Cast Down help clear the way for aggressive attacks, while disruptive cards like Nihil Spellbomb disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck also has a sacrifice outlet in Makeshift Munitions, providing additional reach for finishing off opponents.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifact creatures and sacrifice effects to control the board and generate value. It combines aggressive creatures with removal spells to maintain pressure on opponents. The deck also includes a variety of card draw and recursion effects to ensure consistency and resilience. The inclusion of land destruction spells adds further disruption to the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggression and value-generating abilities.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifact creatures and various artifact spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggro and synergy. By using cards that benefit from artifacts being on the battlefield, it aims to efficiently deal damage and control the game through a combination of removal, card advantage, and mana acceleration. The key strategy involves efficiently casting cheap artifacts to enable powerful cards and abilities that can quickly close out the game before the opponent can respond effectively.

The main focus of this Mono Blue Aggro deck is to quickly play low-cost creatures and establish early board presence. By utilizing cheap creatures and disruptive counterspells, the deck aims to control the game tempo and pressure the opponent. In addition, cards like Moon-Circuit Hacker and Ninja of the Deep Hours provide card advantage and help maintain a steady stream of threats. This deck also includes various Faerie synergies, such as Spellstutter Sprite and Faerie Seer, to further enhance its aggro strategy. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive spells.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game with counter spells and disruptive cards while utilizing cheap card draw and filtering to maintain card advantage. The win condition is to drop efficient threats like Cryptic Serpent and Murmuring Mystic while disrupting the opponent's game plan with bounce spells like Tolarian Terror and Sleep of the Dead. The deck aims to outvalue and out tempo the opponent through efficient spells and smart decision making.

The deck focuses on creating an aggressive Orzhov (White-Black) strategy by utilizing low-cost creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent. It combines efficient creatures like Kor Skyfisher and Glint Hawk with removal spells like Cast Down and Grim Bauble to control the board while steadily building up its own battlefield presence. The deck also includes cards like Refurbished Familiar and Tithing Blade to generate additional value and maintain pressure on the opponent. Overall, the goal is to establish early dominance and quickly close out the game through a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying efficient threats and disrupting opponents' strategies through targeted removal and graveyard hate. It also includes synergies such as sacrificing creatures for benefits and recurring powerful threats from the graveyard. The deck aims to apply constant pressure on opponents and maintain card advantage through card draw effects. Additionally, the deck includes a subtle theme of lifegain to help stabilize against aggressive strategies.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent through a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells. By consistently hitting the opponent with creatures like Voldaren Epicure and Sneaky Snacker, as well as utilizing direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast, the deck aims to reduce the opponent's life total rapidly. Additionally, cards like Guttersnipe and Highway Robbery can provide extra damage or card advantage to help secure victory. Overall, this deck prioritizes fast, efficient damage output to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a low mana cost creature and artifact spells, using cards like Myr Enforcer and Thoughtcast to bring out strong creatures and draw cards efficiently. By utilizing the Affinity mechanic, which reduces the cost of cards based on the number of artifacts in play, this deck aims to win the game quickly by dealing damage fast. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Galvanic Blast and Krark-Clan Shaman to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of using Balustrade Spy to mill a significant portion of your library, then bringing back Thassa's Oracle with Dread Return to win the game. The deck is designed to quickly ramp up mana using creatures like Overgrown Battlement and Elves of Deep Shadow, while also utilizing cards like Land Grant and Lead the Stampede to find key combo pieces. The deck also includes cards like Masked Vandal and Generous Ent to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with creatures and then reanimate them using cards like Dread Return. The combo relies on sacrificing creatures and using recursion effects to bring back powerful creatures like Lotleth Giant for massive damage. The deck also includes cards like Satyr Wayfinder and Momentary Blink to help dig for combo pieces and protect key cards. The mana base is designed to support the deck's strategy by including cards like Survivors' Encampment and Khalni Garden for additional creature generation and mana fixing.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent quickly with low-cost creatures and direct damage spells. Utilize the aggression of cards like Goblin Tomb Raider and Reckless Lackey to quickly chip away at your opponent's life total. Use burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast to finish off your opponent or clear the way for your creatures to attack. The mana curve is kept low to ensure a fast and aggressive playstyle, while also including some equipment cards like Inventor's Axe to give your creatures an extra boost in power.

The key concept of this Aggro Jund deck is to control the board using removal spells like Cast Down and Eviscerator's Insight while ramping up with cards like Cleansing Wildfire and Ichor Wellspring. Additionally, utilizing creatures like Gixian Infiltrator and Krark-Clan Shaman to pressure the opponent and generate card advantage. The deck also has a sacrifice theme with cards like Makeshift Munitions and Fanatical Offering, allowing for additional reach and removal options. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan while ramping up to a powerful late game.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Balustrade Spy combo in order to quickly mill through your deck and put your win condition, Lotleth Giant, into the graveyard. The deck includes various ramp creatures and card draw spells to help facilitate the combo. Additionally, there are cards like Dread Return to bring back Lotleth Giant from the graveyard for a finishing blow. The deck focuses on quickly executing the combo and overwhelming your opponent with a high-powered finish.
